Function.Description: The bmul function computes the product of its arguments.

Brief.Overview: The bmul function computes the product of its arguments. The arguments must be Boolean and the product returned as a Boolean. The operands are not checked and are not coerced. Both operands are treated as integers during the multiply operation. The result is a Boolean true if and only if the result of the operation is a one; otherwise, the result is a Boolean false.
Brief.Usage: The bmul built-in function is a simple but very fast boolean multiplication function. Use the bmul function for highly optimized boolean multiplication.

Argument.Name: bool2
Argument.Note: An arbitrary number of boolean multiplier operands.

Syntax.Return: The product of all the boolean arguments expressed as a boolean.
